### Enhanced Information (For Contextual Support):
Tamsulosin, an alpha-1 adrenergic blocker, is specifically effective in providing symptomatic relief in benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) by relaxing smooth muscles in the bladder neck and prostate, which improves urine flow. Prazosin, also an alpha-1 blocker, is less selective towards bladder and prostate tissues and primarily used for hypertension, thus offering possible but less targeted relief in BPH symptoms. Oxazocin and Dolazoline are not recognized medications and have no established effects on BPH. The evidence paths confirm the role of pharmaceutical preparations in treating BPH and the importance of smooth muscle relaxation in the bladder and prostate for alleviating symptoms, supporting the use of Tamsulosin specifically for BPH.
